solution_line_template: The total cost for the legos are {num_lego_sets} x ${cost_per_lego_set} = $<<{num_lego_sets}*{cost_per_lego_set}={total_cost_legos}>>{total_cost_legos}.
The total cost for the toy swords is {num_toy_swords} x ${cost_per_toy_sword} = $<<{num_toy_swords}*{cost_per_toy_sword}={total_cost_swords}>>{total_cost_swords}.
The total cost for the play doughs is {num_play_doughs} x ${cost_per_play_dough} = $<<{num_play_doughs}*{cost_per_play_dough}={total_cost_play_doughs}>>{total_cost_play_doughs}.

Therefore the total cost for everything is ${total_cost_legos} + ${total_cost_swords} + ${total_cost_play_doughs} = $<<{total_cost_legos}+{total_cost_swords}+{total_cost_play_doughs}={total_cost_everything}>>{total_cost_everything}.
